title: Jaish Handler Shared Bomb-Making Videos With Delhi Blast Accused: Sources
content: Sources said that the Jaish handler got in touch with Muzamil Shakeel through Maulvi Irfan Ahmed - a cleric from Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian who radicalised the doctors and formed the white collar terror module.

title: Headmaster, 3 Teachers Of Delhi School Suspended After 16-Year-Old's Suicide
content: Two days after a student of St Columba's School in Delhi died by suicide by jumping from the platform of a Metro station, school authorities have suspended the principal and three teachers who were named in the FIR filed by the teen's father.

title: "Space Was Easier": Shubhanshu Shukla's Jibe At Bengaluru Traffic
content: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla on Thursday made a light-hearted remark about Bengaluru's relentless traffic during the tech summit here.

title: UK To Make Migrants Wait Upto 30 Years To Settle, Preference To Wealthy
content: In its biggest immigration shake-up in nearly half a century, the United Kingdom is planning to make some legal migrants wait up to 20 years before letting them apply to settle in Britain permanently.

title: "South African President Running His Mouth Against Trump": US On Skipping G20 Talks
content: The United States is not taking part in this weekend's G20 summit in Johannesburg, the White House said Thursday, denying comments from South Africa's president who had said Washington wanted to participate.

title: PM Modi Emplanes For 3-Day Visit To South Africa For G20 Leaders' Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday departed for Johannesburg, South Africa, to attend the first G20 summit, where he will discuss key issues related to India and the global south.

title: Massive Fire At COP30 Venue In Brazil, Likely Caused By Microwave
content: Parts of the venue for the COP30 climate summit in the Brazilian city of Belem were being evacuated on Thursday following reports of a fire.

title: I Practice Buddhism, I'm Truly Secular: Chieft Justice BR Gavai In His Farewell Speech

title: Protesters Try To Stop Manipur's Winter Festival, Clash With Cops
content: Tension erupted in Manipur's capital Imphal on Thursday after police fired tear gas shells at protesters who tried to storm the Sangai Festival 2025.

title: Earthquake Of Magnitude 5.2 Hits Pakistan
content: An earthquake of magnitude 5.2 on the Richter scale jolted Pakistan in the early hours of Friday morning, as per the National Centre for Seismology.

title: "I Intend To Make It Clear...": What Mamdani Said Ahead Of Trump Meeting
content: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani on Thursday said while he has many disagreements with President Donald Trump, he will work with the American leader on any agenda that benefits New Yorkers.

title: Congress Minister, MLAs Loyal To DK Shivakumar Head To Delhi Amid Row
content: A minister and few MLAs loyal to Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar headed to New Delhi on Thursday to meet the Congress top brass, indicating a power tussle in the ruling party, sources said.

title: US Court Halts Trump's National Guard Deployment In Washington DC
content: A federal judge on Thursday moved to halt President Donald Trump's deployment of National Guard troops to Washington, D.C., a temporary legal setback to Trump's efforts to send the military to American cities over objections of local leaders.

title: Freed Israeli Hostage Says He Was Sexually Assaulted By Hamas Captor
content: Guy Gilboa-Dalal, an Israeli hostage released last month after more than two years in captivity, said in a television interview that he was sexually assaulted in captivity in Gaza.

title: Russian Army Claims Capture Of Key East Ukraine City
content: The Russian army claimed on Thursday to have again captured the Ukrainian city of Kupiansk, a key Kyiv bastion in the eastern Kharkiv region where Russia's soldiers have been steadily advancing.

title: After Trump Documentary, BBC Under Fire Over Discredited Diana Interview
content: The BBC came under fire again Thursday in a new book about its bombshell interview with the late Princess Diana, 30 years after it was aired.

title: Google Developing Safe, Trusted AI To Protect Vulnerable Users In India
content: Google on Thursday said that it is developing safe and trusted Artificial Intelligence as part of a broader effort to protect vulnerable users in India, emphasising that safety must serve as the foundation for transformational AI.

title: Belgium Court To Hear Mehul Choksi's Appeal Against Extradition On December 9
content: The case of fugitive diamond trader Mehul Choksi challenging his extradition will come up for hearing before Belgium's supreme court -- the Court of Cassation -- on December 9, officials said on Thursday.

title: Food Regulator Orders Removal Of Any Products Misleadingly Labelled 'ORS'
content: The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India issued an order directing the immediate removal of fruit-based beverages, ready-to-serve drinks, energy drinks, electrolyte drinks and similar products that use the term "ORS" in their brand names.

content: This is the fourth such apprehension in a week, highlighting the Coast Guard‚Äôs sustained efforts to curb illegal fishing and safeguard India‚Äôs maritime interests

content: At the heart of a controversial land deal in Pune, which has created trouble for Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar‚Äôs son Parth Pawar, is a government officer. content: Population First, which is supported by the United Nations Population Fund, has been recognising journalists and creators in news media and advertising for their work on gender sensitivity since the year 2007 through the Laadli awards

content: The festival was designed to celebrate cultural unity and strengthen ties between Telangana and the North Eastern states, it represented a bond that had long been overlooked, the Chief Minister said

content: The Supreme Court on May 5, 2025, had rejected the public interest litigation plea filed by Chinniah seeking investigation into the burial of many bodies in Dharmasthala village between 1995 and 2014

title: India‚Äôs annual maximum temperatures increased across most States from 0.1¬∞C to 0.5¬∞C during last decade: Report
content: This persistent warming has directly translated into record-breaking electricity demand, reaching around 250 GW during the summer of 2024, largely due to surging cooling needs across residential, commercial, and industrial sectors, the report points out

title: ED files supplementary prosecution complaint against Robert Vadra in Sanjay Bhandari case
content: The evidence gathered by the ED indicates that the property acquired by Sanjay Bhandari was ‚Äòbeneficially used by Robert Vadra‚Äô

title: Amoebic encephalitis claims one more life in Kerala
content: 26-year-old woman, a native of Nedumangadu, had developed fever and headache in the first week of October

title: COP30 venue in Belem reopens after fire disruption; climate talks to resume
content: A sudden fire broke out at the COP30 climate conference in Belem, prompting immediate evacuations and bringing crucial discussions to a standstill. While the flames consumed several exhibition pavilions, emergency services were swift in extinguishing the inferno.

title: Delhi St Columba's School suicide case: 4 teachers suspended
content: Four teachers at St. Columba's School have been suspended following the suicide of a Class X student, Shourya Patil. The student's family alleges he was repeatedly humiliated and targeted by teachers. A suicide note found in his bag named the teachers and requested action, prompting protests and an ongoing police investigation.

title: India, Israel set to launch talks for free trade pact
content: India and Israel have officially launched negotiations for a free trade agreement, signing terms of reference to guide discussions. The pact aims to boost trade by removing barriers, facilitating investment, and enhancing cooperation in innovation and technology. Israel has assured India it won't seek market access in sensitive sectors like dairy and agriculture, opening new avenues for bilateral commerce.

title: IND vs SA: Former India cricketer advises Shubman Gill to take a break - 'Skip the IPL' -
content: Shubman Gill's recent neck spasm has sparked debate on player workload. Despite a packed schedule, coach Gautam Gambhir believes players should skip the IPL if workload is an issue, not international duty. Aakash Chopra agrees, emphasizing maximizing form when fit and not mentally fatigued, as Gill faces a recovery period before upcoming series.

title: AI photo-verification: Google feature lets users confirm generated images; how it works
content: Google's Gemini app now allows users to instantly verify if an image was created or edited by Google AI using SynthID watermarking. This feature, initially for images, will soon extend to video and audio, and integrate with industry-wide C2PA standards for broader AI content authentication.

title: Ranji Trophy: Who after Ashwin? Nikhil, the 6'2" bowler from Haryana, is up for the challenge
content: Haryana's Nikhil Kashyap is the lone off-spinner in the top 20 wicket-takers‚Äô list in this season's Ranji Trophy. With 24 wickets in five matches, the 25-year-old, in his debut season, has set the Ranji Trophy on fire. He is ninth on the leading wicket-takers list and, with his tall frame, is someone selectors can keep a close eye on for the future.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock recommendations for today- check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research highlights Fortis Healthcare and Jio Financial Services as top stock picks for November 21, 2025. Nifty and Bank Nifty show positive momentum, with Nifty eyeing its all-time high and Bank Nifty setting new records.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to employees: Must rapidly rethink AI
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has appointed Rolf Harms, the executive behind the influential 2010 "Economics of the Cloud" white paper, to help rethink Microsoft's business model for the AI era. In an internal memo obtained by Business Insider, Nadella emphasized the need to rapidly transform the company's approach to AI economics, similar to its cloud computing pivot 15 years ago. The move reflects Nadella's concerns about Microsoft's survival in the AI era, as he warned employees that some of the company's biggest businesses may become irrelevant without fundamental changes.

title: Indian-origin employee gifted $40,000 by McDonald‚Äôs restaurant owner. Here's why
content: After four decades of dedicated service at a McDonald's in Saugus, Massachusetts, Pargan Singh, endearingly called 'Balbir', has become a local hero. His colleagues, who have watched him grow from a beginner to a beloved team member, surprised him with a lavish red-carpet tribute and a generous $40,000 gift, celebrating an incredible journey of commitment and camaraderie.

title: Jeff Bezos warns of recession: Amazon founder advises what to take off the table
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos is urging consumers and businesses to delay major purchases amid growing recession fears. He advises households to save for big-ticket items like cars and appliances, while small businesses should avoid large capital expenditures.  Despite this caution, Bezos remains optimistic about the long-term American Dream and future space travel accessibility.

title: Thrashed in train for ‚Äònot speaking in Marathi‚Äô, Maharashtra college student kills self
content: A 19-year-old BSc student died by suicide after allegedly being harassed and assaulted on a local train for speaking Hindi. His father claims the incident, where commuters objected to his son's language, caused him extreme distress. Police have launched an investigation into the matter.

title: Lip-Lock legacy: Humans inherited kissing from apes; origins trace back 21mn years
content: A groundbreaking study reveals kissing predates humans by millions of years, originating with ape ancestors in prehistoric Africa. Researchers define it as non-aggressive mouth-to-mouth contact, observing it across diverse species, particularly primates. This ancient behavior, possibly practiced by Neanderthals, may have evolved for mate assessment or social bonding, offering a glimpse into our deep evolutionary past.

title: Savannah James gets emotional as daughter Zhuri joins new SZN Volleyball team
content: Savannah James celebrated her daughter Zhuri Nova's milestone as she begins her volleyball journey with the popular SZN team. Despite her family's basketball background, Zhuri Nova chose a different athletic path. The proud mother shared heartwarming clips and reflected on Zhuri Nova's 11th birthday, highlighting her daughter's intelligence and confidence.

title: Brittany Mahomes says fame as Patrick Mahomes‚Äô wife has been emotionally hard
content: Brittany Mahomes, wife of NFL star Patrick Mahomes, has candidly shared her struggles with online hate. She revealed that while it's been a difficult journey, she's learned to protect her peace by stepping away from social media when negativity escalates. Despite facing criticism for her opinions and public presence, she remains a strong supporter of her husband and their family.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs 'magical' presence leaves Travis Kelce completely speechless
content: Travis Kelce is celebrating Taylor Swift's guest appearance on his podcast, 'New Heights,' which Apple ranked as one of the top episodes of 2025. The episode, recorded before their engagement, shattered viewership records, surpassing even Kylie Kelce's previous mark. Swift shared personal insights, and Travis credits her 'magical' star power for the immense success, highlighting their significant cultural influence.

title: Indian Test team: 'Not even allowed to fail' - Ex-cricketer questions Sarfaraz Khan's omission
content: Meanwhile, former India cricketer Aakash Chopra said Sarfaraz has been affected by a perception issue. Sarfaraz has played six Tests so far, scoring 371 runs at an average of 37.10, with three fifties and one century. ‚ÄãHis highest score in Tests is 150.

title: Bihar: Humble gamcha has its moment under the sun - courtesy PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's use of the 'gamcha' during his victory speech and at the swearing-in ceremony in Patna resonated with supporters, highlighting its significance as a cultural symbol.

title: Fans outraged after article makes offensive jokes about Taylor Swift, Kelce‚Äôs future kids
content: Vulture is facing severe criticism for an article in its 'Stupid Issue' that made ableist and misogynistic remarks, particularly concerning Taylor Swift. The piece, which referenced inherited CTE in hypothetical children, has drawn condemnation from fans and health experts alike for spreading dangerous misinformation and trivializing a serious neurological condition. The article link has since been removed online.

title: INDIA bloc: Cong reaffirms alliance commitment; vows stronger coordination
content: Amidst opposition setbacks, Congress reaffirms its commitment to the INDIA bloc, vowing to strengthen the national alliance. Despite local electoral divergences, the party emphasizes its dedication to coordinating efforts against the BJP's politics at the national level.

title: Bazball reaches its endgame; Eng's hopes hinge on raw pace to recreate Bodyline
content: England enter the Ashes with their quickest pace attack in decades and a matured Bazball philosophy, aiming to end a 15-year drought in Australia. With Mark Wood, Jofra Archer and a battery of genuine quicks, Ben Stokes‚Äô side arrives believing speed can break the long-standing barrier. For Bazball, this is the defining series: victory brings vindication, defeat invites its fiercest scrutiny yet.

title: Aravali protection: SC bars new mining leases; orders sustainable mining plan
content: The Supreme Court has prohibited new mining leases in the Aravali hills to protect them from desertification, while allowing existing operations to continue. The court mandated the preparation of a sustainable mining management plan for the entire range across four states, emphasizing ecological impact analysis and restoration measures.

title: 'Our youth are being profiled': Mehbooba flags harassment of Kashmiris; urges Omar to talk to Centre
content: Kashmiris are reportedly facing harassment and profiling in various parts of India after the Delhi car blast. Political leaders from Jammu and Kashmir are calling on the central government to intervene and guarantee the safety of all Indian citizens, including Kashmiris.

title: 10 yrs of JJ Act: 55% pendency, 1 in 4 boards has no full bench
content: A decade after its implementation, India's juvenile justice system is failing children in conflict with the law. A new study reveals massive case backlogs, widespread vacancies in Juvenile Justice Boards, and a shocking lack of essential facilities, leaving thousands of children in limbo and facing prolonged institutionalization.

title: Bureaucratic reshuffle: Centre appoints seven new secretary-rank babus; Mittal to head petroleum
content: Seven key secretary-rank appointments were made Thursday, including new leaders for oil, telecom, and agriculture ministries. Neeraj Mittal takes charge as Petroleum Secretary, while Amit Agrawal moves to the Department of Telecom. Manoj Joshi transitions to pharmaceuticals, and V Vidyarthi is replaced in tourism. Atish Chandra is set to become the next Secretary for Agriculture and Farmers Welfare.

title: Lamar Jackson injury update: Ravens QB nursing ankle ahead of Week 12 vs Jets
content: Baltimore Ravens' star quarterback Lamar Jackson's ankle injury had fans worried after he missed practice. However, a recent video shows Jackson heading to practice, raising hopes for his participation against the New York Jets. Coach John Harbaugh indicated it's a common physical toll of the sport, with availability for Sunday to be determined.

title: Pull off shelves drinks misusing 'ORS' tag, all states & UTs told
content: The FSSAI has ordered states and Union territories to immediately remove fruit-based beverages and other drinks misusing the term "ORS" from shelves. This directive follows earlier orders to stop the illegal and misleading practice. Enforcement drives will identify and remove non-compliant products, with regulatory action against violators. Genuine WHO-recommended Oral Rehydration Salts, classified as drugs, are exempt from this crackdown.

title: Is Giannis playing vs 76ers? Bucks star ruled out with groin strain
content: Milwaukee Bucks face a significant blow as Giannis Antetokounmpo is out with a left groin strain. This absence alters tonight's Eastern Conference clash against the Philadelphia 76ers. The Bucks are already dealing with depth issues. The 76ers also have injuries, including Joel Embiid being doubtful. This game becomes a test of team resilience for both sides.

title: Robert Vadra beneficiary of London asset: ED chargesheet
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a supplementary chargesheet against Robert Vadra in a money laundering case involving fugitive arms dealer Sanjay Bhandari. The ED alleges Vadra assisted Bhandari and benefited from a London property, claiming he possessed proceeds of crime. The court will decide on cognizance on December 6.

title: Who's best No.4 Test batter? Not Kohli, Sachin or Lara; Ponting picks this cricketer
content: The former Australian men's cricket team captain chose fellow countryman Steve Smith over Miandad. He then picked Steve Smith over West Indies legend Brian Lara, and former South African all-rounder Jacques Kallis. Then put forward with a tough of choosing between Steve Smith and Virat Kohli, Ponting went with Smith. Then he also chose Smith over England batter Joe Root.

title: 'Terror module': Two ISI-linked operatives shot in Punjab; grenades, weapons seized
content: Two suspected ISI-backed module members were injured in a police encounter in Ludhiana after allegedly opening fire.  Acting on intelligence, police intercepted the duo who were tasked by a Pakistan-based handler to exchange grenades. Recoveries included grenades, pistols, and ammunition.

title: Smriti Mandhana flaunts ring; confirms engagement in dance with teammates - watch
content: Indian cricket star Smriti Mandhana has officially announced her engagement to music composer Palash Muchhal through a fun Instagram reel with teammates. The World Cup winner showcased her ring, confirming weeks of speculation. Muchhal was also in attendance for the World Cup final against South Africa. This personal milestone follows Mandhana's stellar performance in India's historic World Cup victory.

title: No more Russian oil: Reliance stops import; crude to be sourced from other nations
content: Effective November 20, Reliance Industries has transitioned away from importing Russian crude for its Jamnagar export-only refinery. By switching to non-Russian sources, the company is making a statement ahead of tightening EU restrictions. This early action positions Reliance to fully comply with product-import guidelines that are scheduled to come into play by January 2026.

title: Look at the 'ugly corners' for the best value in Week 13 of the CFB season
content: this week doesn't come with the shine of ranked matchups or brand-heavy teams . the best edges never show up in the games everyone wants to talk about . that's where these three plays come from .

content: a wave of commitments, decommitments and flips largely driven by three-star prospects shook up these rankings . the number of remaining undeclared prospects in the SC Next 300 is in single digits, but heading into the initial signing period for the 2026 class, many factors can still drive changes .

title: Texas firmly out, Miami in limbo and the G5‚Äôs flavor of the week
content: the new rankings keep Ohio State at the top of the pile, while Texas Tech slides into the no. 5 spot in Week 13 . Notre Dame should buy some furniture and move in . the team's only win against a CFP-ranked team is against no. 15 USC .

title: Eagles' kelly green, Texans' battle red uniforms top NFL Week 12 threads
content: the Houston Texans are wearing their all-battle-red threads on "Thursday Night Football" the combination debuted last season and features a bullhorn on the helmet and shoulder . the Eagles remain undefeated in the look since it debuted in 2023 . for the first time in franchise history, the saints are wearing all-black .

content: the MLS Cup playoffs will feature two players who fit into the former category . MLS 's son Heung-Min and the Vancouver Whitecaps ' Thomas M√ºller' will feature in the playoffs this weekend . it raises the question of why have Son and his team .

title: Fixing what's wrong with Liverpool, Barcelona, Juventus, more
content: the defending champions have lost five of six in league play to fall to eighth in the table . the german side have lost seven of 10 in all competitions . there are plenty of signs that players are still grieving and struggling with the death of teammate Diogo Jota .

title: Follow live: Houston takes back lead on Jayden Higgins touchdown catch
content: HOUSTON -- There's a lot on the line in Thursday's game between the  Buffalo Bills  (7-3) and the  Houston Texans  (5-5). The Texans have a  26% chance to make the playoffs , but that would increase to 37% with a win against the Bills. With a loss, the number would drop to 15%. And on the Bills' side, quarterback  Josh Allen  is on the brink of  making NFL history . Allen, 29, last week tied Cam Newton for the most regular-season career rushing touchdowns by a quarterback. ESPN has you covered on the ground with coverage from Bills reporter Alaina Getzenberg and Texans reporter DJ Bien-Aime. Check here game highlights and key moments from the game:

title: Buzz: Will Burrow, Daniels return? Hottest coaching candidates?
content: insiders Jeremy Fowler and Dan Graziano have been making calls to sources around the league . they got the latest intel on whether we should expect quarterbacks Joe Burrow and Jayden Daniels to get back on the field and help their teams down the stretch . burrow has been out since week 2 because of a toe injury .

title: What happened to last year's AFC juggernauts? Chiefs, Ravens and Texans are all 5-5
content: defending division champions have plenty of work to do in order to reach the postseason . the Texans are thriving in the AFC, including the new England Patriots (9-2) the texans have found their franchise quarterback in Drake Maye and the Denver Broncos .

title: UWCL talking points: Chelsea on the rise? PSG headed for an early exit?
content: UEFA women's champions league draw 1-1 with barcelona at Stamford Bridge . OL Lyonnes salvaged a 3-3 draw against real madrid on friday . frenchman luke shaw drew 2-2 with swansea at the emirates .

title: Flyers to honor young cancer patients with pregame SkateSkins
content: the Philadelphia Flyers take the ice for warm-ups on friday night . it will feature both a heartwarming and history-making little detail that the players will be wearing . sign up now Philly has partnered with SkateSkins, a company that creates customizable skate accessories .

title: How can we reduce CO2?
content: greenhouse gas traps heat in the atmosphere and CO2 levels have increased dramatically since the Industrial Revolution . this is leading to a steep rise in global temperatures, with ever more severe consequences, including storms, flooding, drought and days of extreme heat . the COP30 summit in Belem marks a decade since the historic Paris Agreement .

title: How the Nuremberg Trials prosecuted Nazi war criminals
content: the major war crimes trial against 24 high-ranking representatives of the naz state began on November 20, 1945 . more than 230 witnesses were questioned, 300,000 statements were read out . the choice of Nuremberg as the venue for the trial was not arbitrary .

title: J&K: Kashmir Times office searched overalleged links to secessionist plot; SIA seizes arms, ammo
content: investigators seized a revolver, 14 empty AK-series cases, three live AK rounds, four grenade safety levers, three pistol rounds, documents, and digital devices . the seizures suggest possible unlawful possession and suspected linkages with ‚Äúextremist or antinational elements‚Äù

title: Prez's assent to bills: SC says 'can‚Äôt set timelines for guvs on bills'; scraps ‚Äòdeemed assent‚Äô
content: supreme court unanimously ruled it has no jurisdiction or power to set a timeline for a governor or the president to take a decision on bills passed by state assemblies . this ruling dismantled the April 8 judgment by justices J B Pardiwala and R Mahadevan . the two-judge bench had fixed timelines for governors and the president for taking a . decision on bill reserved for her and involving constitutional questions .

title: Bihar: Nitish 10.0 takes oath; BJP gets 14 ministerial berths, JDU bags 8
content: CM Nitish Kumar took oath along with 26 ministers, 14 from BJP, eight from JDU and four from three other allies . the sight at Gandhi Maidan was a metaphor of the ease in their ties . they include three women and 10 first-timers .

title: ED seizes more assets of Anil Ambani group
content: ED says the special task force has attached more assets, worth over Rs 1,452 crore . ED's investigation under Prevention of Money Laundering Act is based on a CBI FIR against RCom, Anil Ambani and others . anil ambani's spokesperson says he is in no way involved with RCom .

title: Indian, Nasa experts confirm 3I/ATLAS is a ‚Äòcomet‚Äô, rule out ‚Äòalien ship‚Äô theory
content: interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS is currently on its way out of the inner solar system . scientists from a 1.2-metre telescope have captured images of it . it has all the characteristics of a ‚Äúcomet‚Äù while dismissing some astronomers‚Äô theory it could be an ‚Äúalien ship‚Äù

title: TN bills row: 5-judge bench agrees with 2-judge bench on one point ‚Äî guv can‚Äôt sit on bills
content: govt's 2023 writ petition accusing the governor of not acting on 10 bills passed by the state assembly led a two-judge bench to pen a 415-page judgment on April 8 . the ruling stripping the constitutional heads of states of the minimal discretionary power conferred on them by the Constitution .
